meanings.definition: To soften or break down by soaking in a liquid
meanings.sent1: She macerates the fruits in water to make jam.
meanings.sent2: The chef macerates the meat in marinade for tenderness.
meanings.sent3: The sponge macerates in the soapy water, getting squishy.
meanings.sent4: Time macerates memories, turning them bittersweet.
meanings.sent5: The rain macerates the fallen leaves into mushy pulp.

meanings.definition: To cause to waste away or become thin
meanings.sent1: The illness macerates his once strong body.
meanings.sent2: Neglect can macerate a plant, making it wither.
meanings.sent3: Skipping meals will only macerate your health.
meanings.sent4: The harsh winter winds macerate the exposed tree branches.
meanings.sent5: The constant stress can macerate one's spirit over time.

meanings.definition: To undergo softening or breaking down by soaking in a liquid
meanings.sent1: The fabric macerates in the dye, changing color.
meanings.sent2: The cookies macerate in the milk, becoming soggy.
meanings.sent3: The paper macerates in the rain, turning into a mushy mess.
meanings.sent4: The wood slowly macerates in the water, losing its hardness.
meanings.sent5: The bread macerates in the soup, absorbing all the flavors.
